decks.notes: This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures and powerful instant spells to pressure the opponent and quickly close out the game. By playing threats like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls early on and backing them up with removal spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending, you can control the board while pushing through damage. Ephemerate and Quantum Riddler provide additional value and disruption, making it difficult for your opponent to stabilize. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency and allow for easy access to all three colors.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo by using cards like Eldritch Evolution, Neoform, and Summoner's Pact to cheat out Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant for a powerful win condition. Utilizing cards such as Disciple of Freyalise and Planar Genesis to ramp up mana production and generate card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive combo potential. Generous Ent and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide additional support for the combo pieces, while cards like Pact of Negation offer protection to ensure the combo can go off smoothly.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with cards that can quickly build a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, while also having cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Goblin Bombardment for additional damage and removal options. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly close out games. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures while maintaining a solid offensive strategy.

The central focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells, while also utilizing flicker effects like Ephemerate to gain value from enters-the-battlefield abilities. The deck combines red, white, and blue cards to create a versatile and powerful aggro strategy. Key cards like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide strong creatures, while Consign to Memory and Solitude offer removal options. Seasoned Pyromancer and Guide of Souls help with card advantage and card selection. Overall, the goal is to outpace and outvalue the opponent in a fast and aggressive manner.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd in order to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure on their life total. Cards like Solitude and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide removal and disruption, while Quantum Riddler and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer additional ways to close out the game quickly. The deck also includes utility lands like Arena of Glory and Thundering Falls to support its aggressive strategy and ensure a consistent mana base.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of red, white, green, and blue cards, utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Stubborn Denial and Lightning Bolt to control the board and protect your creatures. The Leyline cards provide additional support by buffing your creatures and locking down your opponent's options. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient offensive strategy.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide strong threats, while Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm help clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Blood Moon and Elegant Parlor, to disrupt the opponent's mana base and game plan. With a mix of creatures, removal, and disruption, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board throughout the game.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure to the opponent. It utilizes cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to clear the way for its creatures, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Surgical Extraction. The deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize, using efficient card draw like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to maintain momentum.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to control the game by constantly denying the opponent's threats while generating card advantage through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Cling to Dust. The deck also utilizes creatures with powerful enter the battlefield effects like Solitude and Subtlety. Through efficient removal spells and a consistent mana base, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out in a long game.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also utilizes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes cards like Drowner of Truth and Sire of Seven Deaths for additional board control. With efficient ramp and strong control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan to secure victory.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient spells. The deck utilizes low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, alongside cantrips and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to maintain pressure and control the board. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card selection and velocity, while cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge offer combat tricks and additional reach. The mana base is streamlined yet versatile, ensuring consistent performance and flexibility in adapting to various matchups.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thoughtseize and Flickerwisp, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. By controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy and win the game through a combination of aggression and disruption. Teferi, Time Raveler and Quantum Riddler provide additional support and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver the opponent.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide card advantage and additional threats to maintain pressure. The deck aims to establish a fast and relentless offense while using disruption like Mana Tithe and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Lightning Bolt for additional damage. Goblin Bombardment provides reach and helps finish off opponents. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, while also utilizing cards like Arena of Glory and Voice of Victory to provide additional utility and support for the aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Negation, and Counterspell, the deck aims to control the battlefield and prevent the opponent from establishing a strong board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card advantage and threats to pressure the opponent. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining control and outmaneuvering the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off opponents. Additionally, the inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provides additional support and synergy for the aggressive game plan. The deck aims to apply early pressure, maintain board presence, and ultimately close out the game swiftly.
